item.title: Spring Read Classpath Resource using @Value
item.description: In this Java Spring Framework tutorial, we learn how to use @Value annotation to read classpath resource files located in the resources folder in your Spring application project. (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({}); For example, we have a text file located at /src/main/resources/data.json in the Spring application project. Next step, we implement a new class named ResourceService and implement a method to read the data.json file and return it as a String object.
